steps.title: Girlypop is an internet slang term referring to a stereotypically feminine person.
steps.content: Girlypop is an internet slang term referring to a stereotypically feminine person. A compound of â€œgirlyâ€ and â€œpop,â€ girlypop is often used to refer to people who are very bubbly, fun, and stereotypically girly and cutesy . [1] X Research source It can be used as a noun to greet someone in a fun way (i.e., â€œHey, girlypop!â€) or to describe someone who slaying in a feminine, endearing way (i.e., â€œSheâ€™s so girlypopâ€). [2] X Research source Girlypop is largely considered to be a positive, complimentary term. Like â€œgirly,â€ however, it may be used sarcastically in certain situations to drag someone whoâ€™s perceived as overly feminine or flamboyant, although this meaning isnâ€™t as common. [3] X Research source However, girlypop has varied meanings depending on who youâ€™re talking to. Some people use girlypop to specifically describe men as gay, while others will use it to describe men in the context that theyâ€™re someone that their female friends are comfortable with and feel safe around. In other circles, specifically the lesbian community, a â€œgirlypop mascâ€ is a masculine-presenting lesbian who acts in a very feminine way (as popularized by TikToker @whatsuplavren ). However, thereâ€™s a lot of controversy within the LGBTQIA+ community about the usage and potential implications of this term. The new slang term â€œgirlypopâ€ may be confused for the similar phrase â€œgirly pop,â€ which (often derogatorily) refers to female singers who are seen as especially feminine and girly.

steps.title: Girlypop was popularized on TikTok in 2023, but exact origins are unclear.
steps.content: Girlypop was popularized on TikTok in 2023, but exact origins are unclear. No one knows exactly who invented the slang term â€œgirlypop.â€ However, the word was seen online as early as 2008 on DeviantArt and Twitter (now X). The slang term was further popularized throughout the 2010s and 2020s by YouTuber Haley Pham (@haleypham) , who frequently refers to her viewers as â€œ girlypops .â€ â€œGirlypopâ€ received its first Urban Dictionary definition in 2018, and the word continued to grow in popularity on TikTok throughout 2022, 2023, and 2024. In 2022, TikToker @ally_yost , who has 2 million followers as of August 2024, started using the term to address her viewers. In January 2023, Twitter (now X) user @thebiggestyee made a post using the term. This tweet amassed over 6,000 likes in two months and was later shared on Instagram by @thatgirlpage_ , where it earned over 11,900 likes in one month.

steps.title: â€œI love her energy, she is sooo girly pop.â€
steps.content: â€œI love her energy, she is sooo girly pop.â€ When someone slays really hard or is just so stunning or wonderful that you canâ€™t believe it, you can use girly pop to describe them. While you may use this description to describe someone who looks super girly and feminine, you can use it any time that youâ€™re really feeling someoneâ€™s look or attitude. [4] X Research source For example, Twitter (now X) user @SaturnReturnzss posted this tweet , including a picture of Taylor Swift with the caption â€œsheâ€™s so girly pop.â€

steps.title: â€œHey, girlypop!
steps.content: â€œHey, girlypop! Itâ€™s been too long!â€ Similar to â€œHey, girlieâ€ or the equally-trendy â€œHey, Barbie,â€ you can greet someone as girly pop when you first see or message them. This use of the slang word is usually reserved for female friends, but it doesnâ€™t have to be! A lot of people use this term as a greeting without even thinking about who theyâ€™re addressing or what the meaning of the word really is. [5] X Research source For example, Twitter (now X) user @aysiacchanell replied to womenâ€™s basketball player KK Arnoldâ€™s tweet with this comment : â€œwhile youâ€™re here love you girly popğŸ«¶ğŸ½.â€ KK Arnold ( @KamoreaArnold ) then replied with â€œHey Girly Pop! ğŸ«¶â€

steps.title: â€œI feel super comfy with him, heâ€™s kind of girly pop.â€
steps.content: â€œI feel super comfy with him, heâ€™s kind of girly pop.â€ Some women lovingly refer to their male friends, family members, and even boyfriends as â€œgirly pop.â€ In this context, â€œgirly popâ€ generally means that they feel very safe and comfortable with that man, or their man is doing something to fit into the girly pop vibeâ€”like doing his skincare routine or knowing all the words to a Lana del Rey song. Keep in mind that this usage of girly pop when referring to men does not necessarily mean that someone is commenting on their sexual orientation. For example, TikTok user @ari-rose44 posted this video , which showcased her putting rhinestone gems all over the head of her â€œbald dad.â€ She captioned the video â€œwow heâ€™s a girlypop nowğŸ§šğŸ§šğŸ§šğŸ§š.â€

steps.title: â€œHow did you not know he was girly pop??â€
steps.content: â€œHow did you not know he was girly pop??â€ Some people use girly pop to refer to stereotypically flamboyant gay males. In this context, â€œgirly popâ€ is essentially a substitute for the word â€œgay.â€ [6] X Research source This slang term is used in a supportive and cutesy way, not as a derogatory or offensive term. However, you still may want to avoid using this term with people youâ€™re not particularly close to or to speculate about someoneâ€™s sexuality (especially online).

steps.title: Dress in more feminine and â€œgirlyâ€ styles.
steps.content: Dress in more feminine and â€œgirlyâ€ styles. Although thereâ€™s no one true girly pop aesthetic or way to be more â€œgirly pop,â€ most people would see traditionally feminine styles as the most â€œgirly pop.â€ Stereotypically, dressing in a more â€œgirly-girlâ€ way would mean wearing shades of pink, bouncy skirts , flowy dresses, or anything with feminine details like bows, ruffles, glitter, and hearts. Think Barbiecore or the soft girl aesthetic! [7] X Research source For tweens and teens, dressing more girly pop may be similar to acting basic or â€œ preppy .â€ Being girly pop may entail wearing colorful clothing from brands like Lily Pulitzer, adorning your wrists with friendship bracelets , or sipping on Stanley cups while walking around the mall with your friends or hanging at cheer practice. [8] X Research source However, keep in mind that being and feeling more feminine can mean different things to different people (and being your own version of girly is what girlypop is really about!). To figure out what style feels most feminine and girlypop to you, follow personal stylist Grace Thomasâ€™ advice to â€œstart with a Pinterest board and search words like â€˜feminine styleâ€™ and see what comes up. Youâ€™ll see a range of different things, so try to identify which one stands out to you.â€ Eventually, continues Thomas, when you â€œselect something that feels like you and femininity, youâ€™ll start to feel comfortable, and youâ€™ll start to feel cute.â€ If you try to dress in a super girly way that doesnâ€™t align with your style, however, youâ€™ll end up being less girlypop than how you started out.

steps.title: Make lifestyle changes to embrace the fun and feminine sides of life.
steps.content: Make lifestyle changes to embrace the fun and feminine sides of life. Being girlypop is all about leaning apologetically into the most fun and silly parts of being a girlâ€”whether you actually identify as a girl or not! Indulge in a weekly everything shower or set aside some self-care time for a nightly skincare routine . Listen to girly pop singers like Olivia Rodrigo, Katy Perry, Taylor Swift, Chappell Roan, Sabrina Carpenter, Charli XCX, Hilary Duff, Dua Lipa, or whoever you like best! [9] X Research source Invest in quality time with your friends for fun-filled hangouts at the mall, the beach, or slumber parties.

steps.title: Be kind, open-minded, and true to yourself!
steps.content: Be kind, open-minded, and true to yourself! Most importantly, remember that thereâ€™s no one way to be girlypop. Being girlypop may have originally meant to be super feminine, but itâ€™s evolved to describe anyone that feels like a safe and genuine person. So, focus on being the kindest and most positive version of yourself and bringing your take on girlypop to the table! Donâ€™t feel pressure to be super bubbly or positive all of the time, however. You may be a more introverted person, which is completely fine. Plus, itâ€™s equally girly pop to take time to feel and process your feelings , especially when you or your girly pals need support!

Want to learn some more internet slang terms to use with your nearest and dearest (or your social media following)? Whether youâ€™re interested in more girl-related lingo from TikTok or terminology from Queer spaces, weâ€™ve got you covered. Here are some terms related to the various meanings of girly pop: Girlboss : A successful, ambitious, and career-oriented young woman. [10] X Research source Pick Me Girl : A woman who uses outdated gender stereotypes to put down other women for male attention. [11] X Research source Girlâ€™s Girl : A girl who lifts up and celebrates other women. [12] X Research source Girl Dinner : Trend of women eating random snack boards for dinner. [13] X Research source Girl Math : Jokey trend about how women rationalize pricey purchases. [14] X Research source Soft boy : An adult, cisgender man who defies gender norms by being tender, emotionally open, and sensitive. [15] X Research source Babygirl : An attractive adult man whoâ€™s cutesy, slightly submissive, secure in his masculinity, and a bit of a bad boy without being intimidating. [16] X Research source Masc : Someone whose gender expression is masculine. [17] X Research source Femme/fem or high femme : Someone whose gender expression is feminine. [18] X Research source
